719192f-a.text:
Convent Avenue, west side, south from 141st Street, showing in the background buildings of the College of the City of New York. The apartmment house under construction bears No. 260 and is known as the Sound View Court. It is at the N.W. corner of W. 140th Street.
About 1910.
Neg a 149

719189f-c.text:
(1)
Hamilton Grange, the residence of Alexander Hamilton from 1802 to 1804, 287 Convent Avenue, adjoining St. Luke's (Protestant Episcopal) Church on the N.E. corner of 141st Street. The original site of the house was on the west side of Convent Avenue between 142nd and 143rd Streets. It was chosen by Hamilton in order to be near Morrisiana, the home of Gouverneur
Morris, and was about eight miles from town.
1913.
(2)
A close-up of Hamilton Grange.
1913.
(3)
Hamilton Grange nineteen years later. In the intervening period, the wooden railways have been removed from the roofs.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 523.
(4)
An early view of same.
1891.
Gift of Randall Comfort.

731422f-a.title: Colleges and Universities - College of the City of New York.
731422f-a.text:
College of the City of New York: W. P. A. men are shown working on the foundation for a proposed new building to the college at Convent avenue and West 141st Street. On the left appears the rear of the Library. Across the ramp, Which is Convent Avenue, are two apartment houses and to their left is visible part of the Chemistry Building.
June 16, 1937
W. P. A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project
731422f-a.folder: Convent Avenue and 141st Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

719188f-a.text:
(1)
Convent Ave., adjoining the N.E. corner of West 141st Street. Frame building is "La Grange" the country home (1802-1804) of Alexander Hamilton, and now adjoining St. Luke's P.E. Church, and is now known as the Hamilton-Grange School. Present site is not the original one.
October 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.
(2)
The same, rear view as seen from Hamilton Terrace.
191:.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.
(3)
The same as No. 1.
October 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.  MAY BE REPRODUCED.
